com.example.schultzhattervigweatherviewer

Class ForecastLocation.LoadLocation

  • java.lang.Object
      • com.example.schultzhattervigweatherviewer.ForecastLocation.LoadLocation
  • Enclosing class:
    ForecastLocation

    public class ForecastLocation.LoadLocation
extends

    Description:

    Makes the API call to grab the forecast location information. The class uses .execute(zipCode) to call the async task.

    Date:
            Novemeber 11, 2012

    Extends:
            AsyncTaskS<tring, Void, ForecastLocation>
            String -> Parameter
            Void -> Progress
            ForecastLocation -> Result

    Implements:
            (none)

    Author:
    Josh Schultz, Erik Hattervig

    • Constructor Detail

      • ForecastLocation.LoadLocation

        public ForecastLocation.LoadLocation(Context context,
                             IListeners listener)

        Description:

        Constructor. Sets up the listener which later will be used to notify when the async task is finished.

        Date:
                Novemeber 11, 2012

        Parameters:
        context[in] - - The activity associated with this object
        listener[in] - - The object listening for the result.

    • Method Detail

      • doInBackground

        protected ForecastLocation doInBackground(java.lang.String... params)

        Description:

        The async portion of LoadLocation. This method makes the API call for the forecast location, parses the call, and returns a ForecastLocation object. If there is no network available, or the API call is unsuccessful, null is returned.

        Date:
                Novemeber 11, 2012

        Parameters:
        params[in] - - The zip code for the API call.
        Returns:
        ForecastLocation - The forecast location information from the API call
        null - If the API call failed.

      • onPostExecute

        protected void onPostExecute(ForecastLocation forecastLocation)

        Description:

        After the forecast location is received, this method is automatically called to notify the listener.

        Date:
                Novemeber 11, 2012

        Parameters:
        forecastLocation[in] - - The result of the API call.
